subject: Real Estate
title: Elastic vs. Inelastic Housing Markets
description: A quick, practical guide to Elastic vs. Inelastic Housing Markets.

hook.text: Houston builds more houses per year than the entire state of California. It also has cheaper homes.

buildup.text: Houston has minimal zoning and flat terrain. Builders can respond to demand almost immediately.

discovery.text: Economists call this an 'elastic' market â€” supply stretches easily, so prices stay moderate.

twist.text: San Francisco, hemmed in by hills and water, is 'inelastic.' Demand spikes hit prices, not supply.

climax.text: Geography and regulation, not just demand, determine whether a city's housing is affordable.

punchline.text: Flat land and loose rules keep houses cheap.

quiz.question: What makes a housing market 'elastic'?
options: Supply can respond quickly to demand
